episode_title: 515 - The One With The Girl Who Hits Joey

content.description: The hallway, Ross is running up the stairs. Note: This show continues where the last one left off.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler!!! Chandler!!! (He opens the door to the apartment but is stopped by the chain; Chandler and Monica quickly stop making out and try to get dressed.) Chandler, I saw what you were doing through the window! Chandler, I saw what you were doing to my sister! Now get out here!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow! Listen, we had a good run. What was it? Four? Five months? I mean, that’s more than most people have in a lifetime! So, good-bye, take care, bye-bye then! (He kisses her and starts to climb out the balcony window.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you doing?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I’m going on the lamb.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on Chandler, come on, I can handle Ross. (They go to the door. Ross is trying to stick his hand through and undo the chain; Monica pushes his hand back.) (To Ross) Hold on! (She opens the door.) Hey Ross. What’s up bro?
(Ross spots Chandler and starts chasing him around the kitchen table. Chandler runs and hides behind Monica.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What the hell are doing?!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, what’s-what’s going on?!
content.parenthetical: running from the guy’s apartment with Joey in tow

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I think, I think Ross knows about me and Monica.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude! He’s right there!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I thought you were my best friend, this is my sister! My best friend and my sister! I-I cannot believe this!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, we’re not just messing around! I love her. Okay, I’m in love with her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m so sorry that you had to find out this way. I’m sorry, but it’s true, I love him too.
(There’s a brief pause.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My best friend and my sister! I cannot believe this. (He hugs them both.) (To Joey and Rachel) You guys probably wanna get some hugs in too, huh? Big news!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Awww, no, it’s okay, we’ve actually known for a while.
(There’s another pause as Ross gets angry again.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? What? What?! You guys knew? (Joey and Rachel backup against the door.) You all knew and you didn’t tell me?!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, Ross, we were worried about you. We didn’t know how you were going to react.
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You were worried about me? You didn’t know how I was going to react? (He hugs them both.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, all right, whew! What do you say we all clear out of here and let these two lovebirds get back down to business? (Ross turns and glares at him.) Hey-hey-hey, I-I-I’m just talking here, he-he’s the one doing your sister.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, you know what I just realized? If you guys ever have kids…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa! We’re having kids?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I call Godfather!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You can’t just call Godfather. Don’t you think her brother should be Godfather?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure, if you cared enough to call it first.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Guys, you’re a few steps ahead of us.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, big zero gravity moon steps.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Oh, I just thought of the greatest wedding gift to get you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, I’ll go in on that with you! I couldn’t think of anything.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.
(A girl enters.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, hey Katie! Everyone, this is Katie.

content.speaker: Katie
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, are you ready to go?

content.speaker: Katie
content.text: Yeah, I just gotta run to the bathroom.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh sure, right back there. (Points.)

content.speaker: Katie
content.text: Hey, where are we going to lunch?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I was thinking Chinese food.

content.speaker: Katie
content.text: Ohh, I love Chinese! How did you know I love Chinese?! (She hits him repeatedly as she says that.)
(She heads to the bathroom and Joey sits back down.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She is so cute! You could fit her right in your little pocket!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. I mean I like her a lot, and she’s really nice, but…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She keeps punching me.
(They all laugh.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: In that cute, little, sweet way she just did?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, it’s a lot harder than it looks! Okay? (Quietly) She-she-she’s hurting me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know what you need, you need a bodyguard. Hey Ross, what is Ben doing after preschool?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey listen, come on, Joey is having a problem! A little girl is beating him up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Aww, Joey, come here. (She takes his hand.) Look honey, I know this must be really, really difficult for you and I—Oh, I’m sorry. Am I hurting you?

content.description: Ross’s apartment, he’s unpacking after moving in. There’s a knock on the door and he answers it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! I brought you some house warming gifts.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aww.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Salt, so your life always has flavor.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bread, so you never go hungry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And a scented candle for the bathroom, because well, y’know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks. Thanks. And thanks again.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!
(The door across the hall opens and a guy walks into Ross’s apartment.)

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Welcome to the building. I’m uh, Steve Sarah; I’m president of the tenants committee.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh hi! Ross Geller. And this is my friend Phoebe.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Oh hi Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Mr. President.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: I came to talk to you about Howard.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Howard?

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Yeah, he’s the handy man. He’s gonna be retiring next week and everyone who lives here is kicking in a 100 bucks as a thank you for all the hard work type of thing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh that’s nice.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Yeah. So, do you want to give a check? Or…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. Uhh…

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Oh look, you don’t have to give it too me right now! You can slip it under my door. (Points to his apartment across the hall.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no, it’s not that, it’s just… I-I just moved in.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Well, the guy’s worked here for 25 years.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, but I’ve lived here for 25 minutes.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Oh, okay, I get it. (Starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No wait, look. Look! I’m sorry, it’s just I’ve never even met Howard. I-I mean I don’t know Howard.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Howard’s the handy man!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes but too me he’s just, man.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Okay, fine, whatever. Welcome to the building. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ugh, can you believe that guy!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. I really like his glasses.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross is lamenting to Chandler and Rachel about his troubles in his new building.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …so then President Steve told everyone that I was a cheapskate, and now the whole building hates me! A little kid spit on my knee! Y’know what I’m gonna do? I’m gonna throw a party. That’s right. For everyone in the building, and I’m gonna sit them down and explain to them, I am not a bad guy. I am not a cheap guy! I’m just a guy who-who stands up for what he believes in. A man with principles.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sounds like a fun party.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hmm. Look, Ross, if you want your neighbors to like you, why don’t you just pay the hundred bucks? The party’s gonna cost you way more than that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It doesn’t matter! It’s my principles! We’re talking about my principles!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, I thought it was about your neighbors liking you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, they’ll like me. Once they come to my awesome PAR-TAY! Okay, I gotta run. I gotta go get some nametags. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And that crazy party animal will be your brother-in-law.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Very, very funny, but don’t say things like that in front of Monica. I don’t want you putting any ideas in her head.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, Chandler, you do realize that those ideas are probably already in Monica’s head.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wh-wh-why?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, because she loves you and because you love her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, so, what’s that supposed to mean?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, Chandler, don’t freak out! I’m telling you something you already know! Come on, she broke up with Richard because he didn’t want to have babies. And she’s a woman, and she’s almost 30, and y’know it’s Monica.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t see it that way. Okay? Because, I see two Monicas, the one that was my friend, who lived across the hall, and wanted to have a lot of babies and then the new Monica, who I just started to date. Now, who’s to say what she wants?! I’m right. I’m right. Am I right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, you’re right, you are absolutely right. I mean that makes, that makes everything different.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. It’s not different at all, is it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Not unless different means the same.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is sitting on the couch with Katie.

content.speaker: Katie
content.text: You were so funny with that waiter! You’re such a nut! (She slaps her thighs, Joey jerks, and spills some of his coffee.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know, breadstick fangs are always funny.

content.speaker: Katie
content.text: No, you make them funny. You’re the funny one! (She punches him again and he retreats to the arm of the couch.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, look Katie, uh listen, we-we need to talk. Okay? Umm, look I like you. I-I really do, I like you a lot. Okay? But sometimes when you, when you playfully punch me like that it-it feels like someone’s hitting me with a very tiny but very real bat.

content.speaker: Katie
content.text: Aww, like I could hurt you. Are you making fun of my size? Don’t make fun of me because of my size! (She punches him again and almost knocks him off the arm of the couch.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler and Monica are curled up on one of the chairs.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Isn’t this great?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hmm.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Couldn’t you just stay like this forever? (His eyes snap open.) Chandler! Couldn’t you just stay here forever?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, here, somewhere else, y’know where-where ever. (Gets up.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’m cool. Casual.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What-what are you doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m just hanging out. Y’know, having fun. Y’know with the girl that I’m seeing casually.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Man, I knew it! I knew you were going to do this!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Get all freaked out because everybody was talking and just joking around about marriage and stuff.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you do want all that stuff, right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh and you know what I want!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! You want babies! You have baby fever!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I do not have baby fever!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh please, you are obsessed with babies and-and marriage and everything that’s related to babies and-and marriage! I’ve got an idea, why don’t we turn down the heat on this pressure cooker?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Have you lost your mind? Chandler, this isn’t about me! This is about you and all your weird relationship commitment crap!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nah-uh! I know you! Okay? I know the thoughts that you have in the head—in your head!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You don’t know everything. Did you know that I’m going out with Rachel tonight instead of you? Hmm? And did you know that the only baby around here is you?! And did you know that I can’t even look at you right now?! (She storms out.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I did not know that.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler is getting advice from Ross and Joey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s gonna be okay, right? I mean she’s not gonna leave me? This is, this is fixable.

content.speaker: Ross and Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, yeah, sure. Absolutely.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: By me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, no!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, unless you make some kind of big gesture.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, big!
(Monica enters.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh-oh, shht! The Misses.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Gunther, can I get a coffee (Looks at Chandler) to go?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica. (Goes to talk to her.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m still not done not wanting to talk to you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Just tell me what I need to do to make things right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, that’s what we do. Y’know, I-I mess up and then you tell me how to fix it and then I do and then y’know you think I’m all cute again.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really? I’m really tired of being your relationship tutor. You’re gonna have to figure this one for yourself. All right? Y’know what? If you’re too afraid to be in a real relationship, then don’t be in one. (She walks out.)
(Chandler turns to watch her go and then sees Ross and Joey both with huge grimaces on their faces.)

content.description: Ross’s apartment, he’s having his party, only he’s the only guest. He gets up and puts on a nametag that says Ross, but doesn’t quite like it. So he takes it off and puts on one that says Dr. Geller and he puts the Ross one underneath the Dr. Geller one. Then as he turns off the music, we hear the party for Howard raging in the apartment across the hall.

content.speaker: Party Guests
content.text: Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! (Ross goes to investigate the noise) Howard! Howard! Howard! (They’re holding Howard above their heads.) Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! (He sees Phoebe chanting along with them.) Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Yay!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe! (He grabs her arm to get her attention.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, hi Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I thought this was your party and it turns out it’s a party for Howard. He’s just the sweetest little man! (A guest walks up to her.)

content.speaker: Guest #1
content.text: See ya Phoebe! Oh and hey, thanks for chipping in!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You chipped in?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, uh-huh, a 100 dollars.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe! I can’t believe you gave them money! I thought you agreed it was totally unreasonable that they asked me for that money!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but they didn’t ask me! Y’know? This way I’m just y’know, the exotic, generous stranger. That’s always fun to be.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, but you’re making me look bad!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No I’m not. No! If anything I’m making you look better! They’ll see you talking to me and that’s—I’m a hit!

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Oh hey, Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Oh hey, Ross. Umm, see, I was thinking maybe you two could switch apartments because Phoebe’s more our kind of people. Something to think about. (Walks away.)
(Ross turns and glares at Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, okay, my bad.

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is getting some coffee as Joey enters. He’s looking a little puffy, but that’s probably from the large number of different color sweaters he’s wearing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Wow! You look, you look…big.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks! I’ve been working out. Hey listen, is it obvious that I’m wearing six sweaters?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uhhh, yeah. But it’s not obvious why.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well look, I’m breaking up with Katie so I had to put on some extra padding. Y’know? I mean, if she hits me when she’s happy, can you imagine how hard she’s gonna hit me when I tell her I’m taking away the Joey love?

content.speaker: Katie
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Hiya!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Hey, cute jacket!

content.speaker: Katie
content.text: Oh, thanks! That’s so sweet! (She punches Rachel like she punched Joey.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Ow! (Joey motions, “You see what I mean?!”)

content.speaker: Katie
content.text: Oh, ow! Did Joey tell you to say that? You guys, (Punches Joey) are too much! (Punches Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa! (Laughs) Y’know what Katie? I gotta tell ya I-I-I-I think you are the one who is too much. (She punches Katie back.)

content.speaker: Katie
content.text: Ohh, Joey has the nicest friends! (She punches Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, and the nicest girlfriend! (She retaliates.)

content.speaker: Katie
content.text: You’re so sweet! (Punches Rachel yet again.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, you’re so sweet! (She kicks Katie in the shin.)

content.speaker: Katie
content.text: Oww!!!! Joey, she just kicked me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Katie
content.text: Well? Aren’t you gonna do something?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh…

content.speaker: Katie
content.text: You’d better do something, or I’m gonna walk out that door right now! Well? Are you gonna?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nah.
(She looks at Rachel and storms out. After she’s left Joey hugs Rachel in thanks.)

content.description: Howard’s party, Phoebe is talking Ross up to two more partygoers. Ross isn’t happy about it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s what I’m saying. (Laughs.)
content.parenthetical: ignoring him and continuing her conversation

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe? Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh. (Turns to him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, this is a disaster! Can’t I please just go?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! No! I’m talking you up to people. Just give it a little time, all right? Relax, get something to eat! Okay?
(They go to the food table.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So uh, what did you tell them about me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I was telling them about you and Emily. Y’know, try to get some sympathy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh. (He cuts himself a piece of cake.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But somehow you came off as the bad guy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I think I told it wrong. Y’know, we should talk about that because I don’t totally understand what happened there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh, this cake is really good!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay, see? Things are looking up already!

content.speaker: Guest #2
content.text: Oh my God! Someone cut Howard’s cake! (Ross tries dumping it into a nearby plant.) Who would do a think like that?
(Steve goes over to look at Ross who’s trying to look cool, but has some frosting on his lip.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh yeah, aww!

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Okay, you got your free food! You ruined everyone’s fun! Don’t you think it’s time you went home?!

content.speaker: Guest #3
content.text: Yeah, leave!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah, get out! Now!

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Go back to 3-B, 3-B!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, everyone calm down! Everyone calm down! I have something that I would like to say! Who here likes Ross? (Ross is the only one who raises his hand and Phoebe glares at him to put his hand back down.) Of course you don’t like him! He-he didn’t give you any money, he raised his own hand when I asked, “Who hear likes Ross,” and he’s wearing two nametags! (He takes one off.) I-I’ll be honest with you guys, when I first met Ross I didn’t like him at all! But then once I got to know him I saw that he’s really sweet and caring and very generous. I mean, all I’m saying is don’t judge Ross before you get to know him all right? I mean, I like all you guys now, but when I first meet you y’know Kurt, I thought, y’know abrasive drunk, umm Lola, mind numbingly stupid! And okay, you guys (She turns to an elderly gentleman and a 20 something woman, who’re a couple.) (To the girl) Gold-digger, (To the old guy) cradle robbing perv! So, I think you all know what I mean.

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Ross and Phoebe have been banished to Ross’s place.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Obviously I didn’t think they were gonna start throwing things. I just thought if I kept insulting everyone, you would jump in and defend everyone and then you could look like the hero.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh wow, yeah! See, I did not get that.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler comes running in. Everyone else is already there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Where’s Monica?! Where is she? I need to talk to her! It’s urgent! Is she here?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m Monica.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I need to talk to you, it’s urgent!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I’ve been doing a lot of thinking about us, y’know a lot of uhh, us thinking. And uh, well I guess there’s only one-one way to do this. (He slowly and awkwardly gets down on one knee.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait what-wh-wh-what are you doing?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No-no, don’t-don’t-don’t do it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Will you marry me?
(Phoebe hides her eyes in shame. Rachel is starring at them wide-eyed and open-mouthed. Joey and Ross are stunned to temporary silence.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-no. No. No.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What a bad idea!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhhh, I cannot look at it! (She doesn’t move.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, why are you doing this?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know. But I know I’m not afraid to do this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m doing this because I’m sorry?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you umm, you really think the best reason to get married is because you’re sorry?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, the best reason to get married is pregnancy. Sorry is pretty much fourth y’know, behind being ready and actually wanting to get married. (Laughs.) Will you be my wife?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, umm, I want you to take just a minute and I want you to think about how ridiculous this sounds.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’m kinda wishing everyone wasn’t here right now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey! Do you know that none of that stuff came from me?! I mean I never said I wanted to have babies and get married right now!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah I know, but I was really confused and then I talked to these guys. (Turns to look at Ross and Joey.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who? Two divorces and Joey?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She’s right y’know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, but still, cheap shot!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what? Y’know when I said that I want you to deal with this relationship stuff all on your own? Well, you’re not ready for that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I didn’t think I was!
(They hug.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, what would have done if I said yes?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well I would’ve been happy because I would’ve be able to spend the rest of my life with the woman that I love. Or, you would’ve seen a Chandler shaped hole in that door. (Points at the door.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Ross, will you pass me that knife?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I will not!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, it’s okay. You don’t have to be so mean about it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re right, I’m sorry. Will you marry me?
(They all laugh.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Aw, and I was gonna ask you to marry me because I forgot to say hello to you last week.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no wait Pheebs, I think for something like that you just ask them to move in with you. But I’m not sure, Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, how long is this going to go on.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well I think the length of teasing is directly related to how insane you were so, a long time.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is fun. Hey Rach, remember that whole “We were on a break thing?” Well, I’m sorry, will you marry me? (Laughs—whines as he sees that no one is laughing. They’re just staring at him in shock.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s not funny.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s not funny at all!
(They all get up and leave.)
